text: Jens Christian Skou (; October 8, 1918 - May 28, 2018) was a Danish medical doctor and Nobel laureate. He was born in Lemvig, Denmark. In 1997, he received the Nobel Prize in Chemistry (together with Paul D. Boyer and John E. Walker) for his discovery of Na+,K+-ATPase. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1993. Skou died on 28 May 2018 in Aarhus, Denmark at the age of 99, five months short of his 100th birthday. ==References== ==Other websites== *Nobelprize.org - Autobiography of Jens Christian Skou *Nobelprize.org - Jens C. Skou's Nobel Lecture on "The Identification of the Sodium-Potassium Pump" Category:1918 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Danish chemists Category:Psychologists Category:Danish Nobel Prize winners Category:Members of Academia Europaea
title: Jens Christian Skou
